remarks: If a sum is finite, the usual sum is always a limit point of the topological sum (although it may not be the only limit point). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ tsmsid as of 24-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
tsmsidOLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tsmsidOLD.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
tsmsidOLD.1 $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
tsmsidOLD.2 $e |- ( ph -> G e. TopSp ) $.
tsmsidOLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
tsmsidOLD.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
tsmsidOLD.w $e |- ( ph -> ( `' F " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
tsmsidOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) e. ( G tsums F ) ) $.
